title: Textile, 1800–1850
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: Intaglio and block printed; glazed chintz
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 77 x 47 cm (30 5/16 x 18 1/2 in.)
description: Glazed fragment with staggered medallions enclosing different groups of people in a portrait setting. The medallions are set on ornate capitals. Set in a columnar design, the first column from the left has a repeating group of three women. The central column has a young couple sitting close together; she smells a flower. The right column has a group of two women; the woman on right has a hand on the other's shoulder. The background is filled with delicate foliage. Colors are blue-green, light brown and white. Selvage present.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, 1800–1850.Medium: cotton
Technique: Intaglio and block printed; glazed chintz. 1960-243-1.
